inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: history of asthma for 3 years, suffering from frequent cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath and chest tightness.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted

inclusion.criterion: Positive test for allergic sensitization by prick skin testing
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to comply with study procedures and requirements
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Participant must be willing to comply with study procedures and requirements.

inclusion.criterion: Short-acting beta-agonist use < daily in last 4 weeks
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Positive Methacholine challenge test (i.e. at least 20% fall in FEV1 at a Methacholine concentration of ≤16 mg/ml) at screening protocol before enrollment.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Inability or unwillingness to give written informed consent and HIPPA authorization
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Positive test for serum neutralizing antibody to rhinovirus (strain-16) at screening within 6 weeks
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted

exclusion.criterion: Total IgE levels measured at screening protocol that are too elevated based on a subject's weight, to meet the recommendations for treatment with Omalizumab
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Chronic heart disease, lung diseases other than asthma, or other chronic illnesses, including primary and/or secondary immunodeficiency
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hospitalization or treatment in the ER for asthma (unless the treatment involved the use of a bronchodilator only) during the last three years
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects who have had one or more night time awakenings caused by asthma symptoms and/or who have needed their short acting beta-2 agonist (SABA; e.g., albuterol) inhaler for asthma symptoms > 4 days during the week before enrollment, or during the week before the virus challenge
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Intubation or management in the intensive care unit for an asthma exacerbation
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of asthma and is currently using inhaled corticosteroids. He has had symptoms of cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath that worsen throughout the work week.
